questions.title: Find the Three Largest Numbers
questions.prompt: Given an unsorted array of integers, find the three largest distinct numbers in the array. Optimize for space complexity.
followups: How would you solve this in O(n) time with O(1) space?
What if the array contains duplicates?
How does your approach change if you need the top K elements?

questions.title: Reverse Words in a Sentence (Linked List)
questions.prompt: You are given a linked list where each node contains a single character. The entire list represents a sentence. Reverse every word individually while keeping the word order intact.
followups: How do you identify the start and end of each word?
What is the time and space complexity of your approach?
How would you handle punctuation attached to words?

questions.title: Maximum Units on a Truck
questions.prompt: You are assigned to load boxes onto a truck. You are given a 2D array `boxTypes` where `boxTypes[i] = [numberOfBoxes_i, numberOfUnitsPerBox_i]`. The truck has a maximum load size `truckSize`. Return the maximum total number of units that can be loaded.
followups: Why does sorting by units per box yield the optimal solution?
What is the time complexity of your approach?
How would you solve this without using a sort (counting sort)?

questions.title: Remove Duplicates from Unsorted Linked List
questions.prompt: Given the head of a linked list, remove all nodes that have duplicate values, leaving only distinct numbers from the original list. Return the head of the modified linked list.
followups: How do you handle the case where the head node itself is a duplicate?
What is the time and space complexity?
How would you solve this in O(1) extra space if the list was sorted?

questions.title: Kth Largest Element in an Array
questions.prompt: Given an integer array `nums` and an integer `k`, return the `kth` largest element in the array. You must solve it without sorting the entire array.
followups: What is the time complexity of the heap vs quickselect approach?
How do you handle duplicate values?
What if the array is a stream and you cannot store all elements?

questions.title: Valid Parentheses
questions.prompt: Given a string `s` containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.
followups: Why is a stack the optimal data structure here?
What is the space complexity in the worst case?
How would you extend this to validate XML/HTML tags?

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
questions.prompt: Merge two sorted linked lists and return it as a new sorted list.
followups: What is the iterative vs recursive approach?
What are the edge cases (one list empty, both empty)?
How would you merge K sorted lists?

questions.title: Two Sum
questions.prompt: Given an array of integers `nums` and an integer `target`, return indices of the two numbers that add up to `target`.
followups: What is the time complexity of the brute force vs hashmap approach?
How would you handle duplicate pairs?
What if the array is sorted?

questions.title: Reverse a Linked List
questions.prompt: Reverse a singly linked list.
followups: What is the iterative and recursive solution?
What is the space complexity of the recursive solution?
How would you reverse a doubly linked list?

questions.title: Min Stack
questions.prompt: Design a stack that supports push, pop, top, and retrieving the minimum element in constant time.
followups: How do you handle duplicate minimum values?
What is the space complexity of your approach?
Can you implement it with O(1) extra space?

questions.title: Frequency Stack
questions.prompt: Design a stack-like data structure that supports push, pop, and popMax (pop the most frequent element). If there is a tie, pop the element closest to the stack's top.
followups: How do you maintain the frequency of each element?
What data structure do you use to group elements by frequency?
What is the time complexity of each operation?

questions.title: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) Pillars
questions.prompt: Explain the four pillars of Object-Oriented Programming. Provide a real-world example for each.
followups: How is abstraction different from encapsulation?
Give a Salesforce-specific example of polymorphism.
Why is inheritance sometimes considered harmful (composition over inheritance)?

questions.title: Class vs Object
questions.prompt: What is the difference between a class and an object? Provide a code example.
followups: How is memory allocated for a class vs an object?
Can you have an object without a class?
What is a static class?

questions.title: Virtual Functions / Polymorphism
questions.prompt: What is a virtual function? Provide a real-world example of where it is useful.
followups: How does dynamic dispatch work under the hood (vtable)?
What is the difference between virtual and pure virtual?
Can constructors be virtual? Why or why not?

questions.title: Method Overloading vs Overriding
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between method overloading and method overriding.
followups: Which one is resolved at compile-time and which at runtime?
Can you override a private or static method?
What is covariant return type?

questions.title: Queue with getMax()
questions.prompt: Design a queue data structure that supports enqueue, dequeue, and getMax() operations in O(1) amortized time.
followups: Why does a monotonic deque help maintain the maximum?
How is this different from a stack with getMax()?
What is the space complexity of your design?

questions.title: Linked List Cycle Detection
questions.prompt: Given the head of a linked list, determine if the list has a cycle in it.
followups: Why does Floyd's Tortoise and Hare algorithm work?
What is the time and space complexity?
How do you find the node where the cycle begins?

questions.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
questions.prompt: Given an array `prices` where `prices[i]` is the price of a given stock on the ith day, maximize your profit by choosing a single day to buy and a different day in the future to sell.
followups: What is the single-pass greedy solution?
How would you handle unlimited transactions?
What about transactions with a cooldown?

questions.title: Move Zeroes
questions.prompt: Given an integer array `nums`, move all 0's to the end of it while maintaining the relative order of the non-zero elements. Do it in-place.
followups: What is the time complexity of the optimal solution?
How many write operations does your algorithm perform?
What if you need to move zeros to the front instead?

questions.title: Why Salesforce?
questions.prompt: Why do you want to intern at Salesforce?
followups: What do you know about Salesforce's 1-1-1 model?
Which Salesforce product or acquisition interests you the most (e.g., Slack, Tableau, MuleSoft)?
How do you align with the Ohana culture?

questions.title: Behavioral: Challenging Situation
questions.prompt: Tell me about a recent challenging situation you handled in a project. What were the technical details?
followups: How did you diagnose the problem?
What was your specific role in the solution?
What was the outcome and what did you learn?

questions.title: Behavioral: AI Tool Usage
questions.prompt: How do you use AI tools (like Copilot or ChatGPT) in your development workflow? What are your views on their growing use?
followups: How do you verify the correctness of AI-generated code?
What are the risks of relying on AI?
How do you think AI will change the role of software engineers?
